articles.author: Bansari Kamdar, Johann Cherian
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes fell on Wednesday ahead of a key inflation report this week, with investors also assessing remarks from U.S. Federal Reserve officials.
articles.title: Wall Street falls ahead of CPI inflation data

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. regulators said on Wednesday they will extend temporary cuts to minimum flight requirements at congested New York City-area airports and Washington National Airport through Oct. 28, citing air traffic controller staffing issues.
articles.title: US FAA extends cuts to airlines' minimum flight requirements at NY airports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WeWork (WE.N) warned of a possible bankruptcy in a stunning reversal of fortune for the shared workspace provider that four years ago was one of the world's most prized startups with a valuation of $47 billion.
articles.title: WeWork shares sink after warning of bankruptcy risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bankrupt trucking company Yellow Corp (YELL.O) will not seek court approval to borrow $142.5 million from private equity firm Apollo Global Management at a Wednesday court hearing, instead choosing to delaying its request to a future court date.
articles.title: Trucking firm Yellow delays request to approve $142.5 million bankruptcy loan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Verizon Communications (VZ.N) is raising prices on some of its wireless plans as the No. 1 U.S. telecom firm by subscribers looks to boost revenue growth after a post-pandemic slowdown.
articles.title: Verizon to raise prices again

articles.author: Ross Kerber
articles.description: Boards of S&P 500 companies made recruiting directors with financial expertise their top priority over the past year, slowing boardroom gains for minorities, according to a new report.
articles.title: US boardroom diversity gains slow as S&P 500 seeks resumes from finance

articles.author: Karen Freifeld, Andrea Shalal, David Shepardson
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed an executive order that will narrowly prohibit certain U.S. investments in sensitive technology in China and require government notification of funding in other tech sectors.
articles.title: Biden signs order to ban certain tech investments in China

articles.author: Jacqueline Thomsen, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. special counsel investigating Donald Trump obtained a search warrant for the former president's Twitter account in January and the company delayed complying, according to a U.S. appeals court opinion on Wednesday.
articles.title: US obtained search warrant for Trump's Twitter account in Jan. 6 probe - court

articles.author: Boureima Balima, Abdel-Kader Mazou
articles.description: Niger's military junta met with two Nigerian envoys on Wednesday, offering hope for dialogue before a summit with regional leaders that could result in military action to restore democracy.
articles.title: Niger junta meets Nigeria envoys ahead of summit with regional leaders
